fu.esi

Class IMI_NearIndex<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.esi.IMI_NearIndex<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IMI_NearIndex_ByteArray

    public class IMI_NearIndex<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A NearIndex allows to query for the nearest object to a certain point. This index fully resides in memory (IMI, In-Memory-Index). The index is based on Voronoi diagrams. For each point, the MBR of the respective Voronoi region (if closed) is stored in an Extended Split Index. For infinite Voronoi regions an MBR with the maximum search distance is stored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IMI_NearIndex

        public IMI_NearIndex(double maxMeters)
        Creates an in-memory NearIndex.
        Parameters:
        maxMeters - maximum distance after which the nearest is not of interest any more (i.e. MBR distance for objects at the border)

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(T obj,
                     double lat,
                     double lon)
        Register an object for a certain point. Later it can be searched by another point, if this object is the nearest.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object
        lat - point latitude
        lon - point longitude

      • close

        public void close()
        The list of registered objects is complete and the index now can be searched. It is not possible to register new objects.

      • getNearestTo

        public DDDO<T> getNearestTo(double lat,
                            double lon)
        Get the nearest object to the given point, if there is one inside a circle of maxMeters
        Parameters:
        lat - point latitude
        lon - point longitude
        Returns:
        an object that contains the geo object and the distance in meters to the given point (d1) and the coordinate of the object (d2, d3). null, if there is no inside maxMeters
